newsitem.title: ZAMBIA: ZCCM revises July copper output.
newsitem.headline: ZCCM revises July copper output.

text.p: Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines (ZCCM) on Thursday revised July copper production to 24,885 tonnes from the provisional 23,965 tonnes announced earlier.
Production was still lower than the 29,819 tonnes in June due to a fire which closed down one of two smelters last month.
"The figures... from the central bank were provisional," a company spokesman Francis Musonda told Reuters.
Copper output at the Mufulira plant fell by 5,022 tonnes in July due to the smelter shutdown.
Musonda said on Wednesday that the Mufulira smelter was now fully operational, and the company would recover the production shortfall during the year.
Cobalt production dropped to 259 tonnes from 457 tonnes.
"Cobalt production dropped due to the shutdown of the Chambishi cobalt plant in July. It had nothing to do with the fire at the electricity furnace at Mufulira division," Musonda said.
